docs.title: Career Summary
docs.text:
• Kelvin Joson is a results‑driven professional with 19+ years of expertise in Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES), Agile methodologies, and product ownership, delivering global rollouts and process improvements across semiconductor and automotive industries.
  • Currently leading the development and migration of a SaaS Software‑Defined Vehicle CI/CD Engineering Portal, integrating enterprise‑grade solutions such as GitHub Enterprise, Atlassian Cloud/Datacenter (Jira, Confluence), JFrog Artifactory, Jenkins, Vault, Keycloak, Gitea, and an AI Agent Chatbot powered by Google ADK to accelerate engineering productivity.
  • Skilled in bridging technical and business requirements, with proficiency in Python, C#, Docker, AWS, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Rancher, and Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
  • Proven leader, mentoring teams and driving Agile adoption while implementing automated testing frameworks that reduced manual QA effort by 80%.
  • Spearheaded the AWS‑to‑GCP migration, earning multiple Google Cloud skill badges in 2025 (Cloud Run, Kubernetes Engine, Terraform, Load Balancing, Security, AI, Core Infrastructure).
  • Experienced in CI/CD pipelines, cloud‑native microservices, and data analysis (Pandas, Matplotlib, Power BI, Spotfire), complemented by expertise in hardware integration (PLC TCP/IP, VISCOM AOI, ASM Placement Machines).

docs.title: Technical Stack
docs.text:
• Cloud & DevOps: GCP (Cloud Run, Cloud Functions, GKE, Cloud Build, Artifact Registry, Pub/Sub, BigQuery, IAM, VPC, Load Balancing, Security, AI, Google ADK for AI Agent development), AWS, Azure, Docker, Rancher Desktop, SUSE Rancher, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Terraform, Cloud Deployment Manager
  • Identity & Security: Okta, Keycloak, Vault, SAML, OIDC, API authentication/authorization, Cybersecurity fundamentals
  • CI/CD & Engineering Portal Tools: GitHub Enterprise, Atlassian Cloud/Datacenter (Jira, Confluence), JFrog Artifactory, Jenkins, Gitea, AI Agent Chatbot integration
  • Frameworks & Testing: FastAPI, Pytest, Playwright, Selenium, SpecFlow, Serenity‑BDD, Allure Report
  • Programming Languages: Python, C#, C/C++, Bash, Perl
  • Data Analysis & Reporting: Pandas, Matplotlib, Numpy, Jupyter, MATLAB, Power BI, Spotfire
  • Monitoring & Logging: Cloud Monitoring, Cloud Logging, Error Reporting
  • MES & Manufacturing Tools: camLine LineWorks, FranCo/COMCELL, MES Driver Application, SOLO Interface, Loader Application, Checkin/Checkout Applications, GHP
  • Hardware Integration: PLC TCP/IP Communication, ASM Placement Machines, VISCOM AOI Interfaces
  • Diagramming & Documentation: PlantUML, Python Diagrams, Mermaid, MkDocs Material, Markdown, Obsidian, Foam
  • IDEs & Development Tools: Visual Studio, VS Code, SQL Developer, PL/SQL Developer, LabWindows/CVI, LabView, Platform IO, Arduino, GitHub Copilot, Amazon Q
  • System Administration & Virtualization: Windows/Linux administration, WSL2, Hyper‑V, VMWare

docs.title: Aumovio (formerly Continental) – Taguig City, Philippines (15 years 6 months)
Lead Developer (5 months)
docs.text:
Company rebranded from Continental to Aumovio in September 2025. Hybrid · Full-time · Jul 2025 – Present

As Lead Developer, I drive the full software development lifecycle from design and coding to integration, testing, and validation. I lead agile teams to deliver high-quality solutions on time, ensuring operational reliability and scalability. My role spans both proactive development and reactive support, including 3rd level analysis and resolution of complex production issues.

Key Achievements & Responsibilities:

  • Completed onboarding and technical training for Google Cloud Platform (GCP) to lead the backend migration from AWS.
  • Directed agile delivery of software components, balancing technical precision with business priorities.
  • Provided 3rd level support to resolve critical production and development issues, improving system stability.
  • Derived and documented specifications to guide development and production-level implementations.
  • Oversaw design, coding, testing, debugging, and documentation of new software components.
  • Championed best practices in software engineering, fostering contributor empowerment and audit-ready documentation.
  • Ensured quality and timely delivery across the entire software development lifecycle.

docs.title: Senior Consultant, Manufacturing Execution System (MES) Integration (11 years)
Core System Rollout / Support and Quality Apps Team Lead
docs.text:
Hybrid · Full-time · Apr 2025 – Jun 2025

Key Achievements & Responsibilities:

  • Acted as Product Owner for sub-team modules, managing releases, features, and agile planning.
  • Coordinated timelines, created Jira items, and facilitated cross-team collaboration for PI planning.
  • Designed and implemented the automated testing framework, replacing manual processes and improving QA.
  • Delegated tasks and trained team members to contribute to automated testing solutions.
  • Supported other sub-teams (Core System Apps, Core System Reporting) with documentation and training.

docs.text:
Hybrid · Full-time · Mar 2019 – Mar 2025

Key Achievements & Responsibilities:

  • Prepared project documentation and trackers for clear communication.
  • Conducted knowledge transfer sessions for technical and non-technical teams.
  • Executed manual and automated test plans across the SDLC.
  • Actively engaged in SAFe agile teams, ensuring transparency and collaboration.

docs.title: Texas Instruments – Baguio City, Philippines (5 years)
Test Product Engineer
docs.text:
Onsite · Full-time · Nov 2005 – Apr 2010

As Test Product Engineer, I supported high‑volume semiconductor manufacturing by optimizing test processes, developing tools, and ensuring product reliability. I contributed to production ramp‑ups, training, and quality assurance while collaborating across teams to drive yield improvements and operational efficiency.

Key Achievements & Responsibilities:

  • Successfully facilitated production ramp‑up, improving team readiness and operational efficiency.
  • Developed a web‑based reporting tool (Perl, HTML, shell scripting, SQL/Oracle) that enabled Burn‑in Engineers to prevent thermal runaways, enhancing product reliability and safety.
  • Prepared loadboards, test programs, and parameters for production ramp‑up, ensuring seamless transition to high‑volume manufacturing and boosting efficiency by 5%.
  • Created training materials for operators, significantly improving proficiency with new test programs and equipment.
  • Conducted Gauge R&R studies on newly offloaded devices, ensuring measurement accuracy and compliance with industry standards.
  • Established quality control checkpoints and performed risk assessments to proactively maintain production integrity.
  • Analyzed test solutions and statistical yield fallout, achieving a 6% yield improvement and reduced test time.
  • Collaborated with cross‑functional teams to optimize manufacturing test flows, driving continuous yield improvements.
  • Acted as customer liaison, resolving technical issues and fostering strong client relationships.

docs.title: Test Product Engineer Apprentice
docs.text:
Onsite · Apprenticeship · Feb 2005 – Jul 2005

Completed the Texas Instruments Apprenticeship Program with certifications in manufacturing processes and equipment. Extended apprenticeship due to outstanding performance, contributing to critical automotive customer reject verification.

Key Contributions:

  • Assisted product test engineers with daily operations and troubleshooting setup‑related issues.
  • Conducted failure analysis and managed disposition of devices failing continuity tests, ensuring compliance with specifications.
